Les points que vous avez entrez sont :
P_0= ( 1.0000000000000000E+000,  6.0000000000000000E+000)
P_1= ( 2.0000000000000000E+000,  3.0000000000000000E+000)
P_2= ( 3.0000000000000000E+000,  0.0000000000000000E+000)
P_3= ( 4.0000000000000000E+000,  2.0000000000000000E+000)
P_4= ( 5.0000000000000000E+000,  6.0000000000000000E+000)

La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 1 au point 2 est : 
S1(X)=  0.00000000000000000000E+0000*( 2.0000000000000000E+000-X)^3 + -3.21428571428571433849E-0001*(X- 1.0000000000000000E+000)^3 +  6.00000000000000000000E+0000*( 2.0000000000000000E+000-X) +  3.32142857142857143393E+0000*(X- 1.0000000000000000E+000) 
La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 2 au point 3 est : 
S2(X)= -3.21428571428571433849E-0001*( 3.0000000000000000E+000-X)^3 +  1.28571428571428573540E+0000*(X- 2.0000000000000000E+000)^3 +  3.32142857142857143393E+0000*( 3.0000000000000000E+000-X) + -1.28571428571428573540E+0000*(X- 2.0000000000000000E+000) 
La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 3 au point 4 est : 
S3(X)=  1.28571428571428573540E+0000*( 4.0000000000000000E+000-X)^3 +  1.78571428571428566137E-0001*(X- 3.0000000000000000E+000)^3 + -1.28571428571428573540E+0000*( 4.0000000000000000E+000-X) +  1.82142857142857143382E+0000*(X- 3.0000000000000000E+000) 
La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 4 au point 5 est : 
S4(X)=  1.78571428571428566137E-0001*( 5.0000000000000000E+000-X)^3 +  0.00000000000000000000E+0000*(X- 4.0000000000000000E+000)^3 +  1.82142857142857143382E+0000*( 5.0000000000000000E+000-X) +  6.00000000000000000000E+0000*(X- 4.0000000000000000E+000) 

Pour afficher ces fonctions splines sur un intervalle plus appropri√© dans Geogebra :
fonction[S1(x), 1.0000000000000000E+000, 2.0000000000000000E+000]
fonction[S2(x), 2.0000000000000000E+000, 3.0000000000000000E+000]
fonction[S3(x), 3.0000000000000000E+000, 4.0000000000000000E+000]
fonction[S4(x), 4.0000000000000000E+000, 5.0000000000000000E+000]
